detaileddescription.para: Constructor.
Destructor.
This method shuts down this application.
This method creates a base entity on this app. It is used to create a client proxy or base entities.
This method creates a base entity on this app. It uses provided template id to populate the properties from local data.
This method handles a message from the database telling us that a player is trying to log on to an active entity.
This method handles a message from the BaseAppMgr to inform us that there is a new global base.
This method handles a message from the BaseAppMgr to inform us that a global base has gone.
This method handles a message from the BaseAppMgr to inform us that there is a new global base.
This method handles a message from the BaseAppMgr to inform us that a global base has gone.
This method receives a forwarded watcher set request from the BaseAppMgr and performs the set operation on the current BaseApp. parameters in 'data'.

parameterdescription.para: The address from which this request originated.
The data stream containing the watcher data to set.

detaileddescription.para: This method is called when a new Cell App Manager is started.
This method is called when a new BaseAppMgr is started.
This method is called when a cell application has died unexpectedly.
This method will call Base::emergencySetCurrentCell if the base is available, otherwise it will ack the message anyway.
This method is called by the BaseAppMgr on all BaseApps when the system is ready to start, however, only one base app will have the 'bootstrap' argument passed as true.
This method is called by the BaseAppMgr to tell us to shut down.
This method is called by the BaseAppMgr to tell us to shut down.
This method triggers a controlled shutdown of the cluster.
This method is called to set the information that is used to decide which BaseApp BigWorld.createBaseAnywhere should create base entities on.
This method handles a message telling this BaseApp to start handling the backup of a subset of another BaseApp's entities.
This method handles a message telling this BaseApp to stop handling the backup of a subset of another BaseApp's entities.
This method handles a message containing the backup information for a base entity on another BaseApp.
Backup the given base locally. When this app is retiring, it is the backup for all the entities it offloads.
This method creates a base entity from the given backup data stream as a restore or offload.
This method handles a message sent to this BaseApp telling us that we should no longer back up of specific entity. This is called when the base entity is destroyed.
Handler when other BaseApps are started.
This method handles a message informing us that another BaseApp has died.
This method handles a message from the BaseAppMgr telling us what BaseApps this BaseApp should back up its entities to.
Once we have started retiring, we wait for acknowledgement from the BaseAppMgr that it will no longer adjust the backup hash of this app.
This method returns the backup address for an entity.
This method is called by the BaseAppMgr to inform us that a shared value has changed. This value may be shared between BaseApps or BaseApps and CellApps.
This method is called by the BaseAppMgr to inform us that a shared value was deleted. This value may be shared between BaseApps or BaseApps and CellApps.
This method handles a message from DBAppMgr to mark that there will be shards under transition in the cluster.
This method handles the Mercury updateDBAppHash message.
This method handles the setClient message.

This method handles a message from a CellApp to indicate that the next should be made reliable. It is needed when volatile position messages are used to select the entity that subsequent messages will be delivered to, and also when reference position messages are sent.
This method handles a message from the client. Should be the first message received from the client.
This method handles a message from the client. It is used to indicate which proxy subsequent message are destined for.
This method initialises the scripting environment and sets up the the special additions of the Base App.
This method returns the storage-shard hash.
This method returns the database gateway instance.
This method raises the flag to commit to secondary DB on the first occasion
This method adds a base from this manager.
This method adds a proxy from this manager.
This method removes a base from this manager.
This method removes a proxy from this manager.
This method adds a proxy to the pending logins list.
This method calls the onAppShutDown callback with the given stage argument.
Set the current base or proxy for call.

parameterdescription.para: The base or proxy to set for subsequent calls.
Whether this is for client-initiated calls or not.

detaileddescription.para: Get the current base.

parameterdescription.para: If false, then an error message will be output if no base for call is set, otherwise, no error message will be output.

simplesect.para: The base for call if it is set, NULL otherwise.

detaileddescription.para: Get the current proxy for call.

parameterdescription.para: If false, then an error message will be output if no base for call is set, or the base is not a proxy, otherwise, no error message will be output.

simplesect.para: The current proxy for call if it is set, otherwise NULL is returned. If a current base for call is set but not a proxy, NULL is returned.

detaileddescription.para: Clears the current proxy for call and returns it.

simplesect.para: The previous current proxy for call, or NULL if none existed or a non-proxy base was set for call.

detaileddescription.para: Common function for obtaining a proxy to send a message to or complain if it is not able to get a valid one. Only really makes sense to use in external message handlers.
This helper method pickles the input object.
This helper method unpickles an object from the input string.
This method starts the game tick timer for this app.
This method is used to identify when all components are ready so that we can work out when we are ready.
This method registers the secondary database

This method returns whether the next packet forwarded to the client should be made reliable. It is used by CellApp to force volatile messages to be reliable if they are being used to "select" the entity that subsequent messages are destined for.
Note that this state is cleared on read.
Returns true if a CellApp at the specified address is known to have died recently.
Find out the external address of another baseapp
Request that this BaseApp start retirement.
This method records and sets up the forwarding for an offloaded base entity.

memberdef.argsstring: (EntityID entityID, const Mercury::Address &srcAddr, const Mercury::UnpackedMessageHeader &header, BinaryIStream &data)
memberdef.name: forwardBaseMessageIfNecessary

detaileddescription.para: This message forwards a message to a recently offloaded base entity.
This method handles the forwarding of a message for a Base forwarded on from a BaseApp that had offloaded the Base to this location.
This method is called to send a base entity backup to a remote BaseApp.

parameterdescription.para: The user data associated with this request, returned back to the callback on completion.

detaileddescription.para: Return true if the given entity ID has been offloaded to another BaseApp due to retirement.
This method handles the acceptClient request.

memberdef.argsstring: (BaseAppMgr &baseAppMgr, const Mercury::Address &intAddr, const Mercury::Address &extAddr, int id, bool isServiceApp)
memberdef.name: BaseApp

detaileddescription.para: Constructor
This method returns whether or not the Base App Manager has heard from this Base App in the timeout period.
This method estimates the cost of adding an entity to the BaseApp.

memberdef.argsstring: (const Mercury::Address &newAddr, BaseAppsIterator baseApps, AdjustBackupLocationsOp op, bool hadIdealBackup, bool hasIdealBackup)
memberdef.name: adjustBackupLocations

detaileddescription.para: This method adjusts the backup locations for this BaseApp. It is called when a BaseApp is added or removed from BaseAppMgr.
This method handles a message from a BaseApp informing us that it is ready to use its new backup hash.
This method sends DBApp hash data to a BaseApp.
This method sends pre-streamed hash data to a BaseApp.
This static method makes a watcher associated with this object type.
This method initialises this object.

parameterdescription.para: The number of elements in argv.

detaileddescription.para: Signal handler.
This method is called on StartOfTick, before the Updaters are updated. We use it here to execute the update step on all the despair objects and components
This method starts the appropriate services on this ServiceApp.
This method does the portion of the init after this app has been successfully added to the BaseAppMgr.
This method initialises the external interface
This method initialises the secondary database.
This method finds the other processes that this BaseApp needs to know about.
This method sets up the network interfaces.
This method adds the watchers that are associated with this object.
This method backs up this BaseApp's entities. Each call of this method, a proportion of the entities are backed up to the BaseApps that they hash to.
This is the first level of fault tolerance for BaseApps. The second level is archiving. See BaseApp::archive.
This method archives this BaseApp's entities. Each call of this method, a proportion of the entities are backed up to the BaseApps that they hash to.
This is the second level of fault tolerance for BaseApps. The first level is backing up. See BaseApp::backup.
This method handles timeout events.
This method ticks the game time.
This method checks whether there are any entity channels that are close to overflowing. A callback is called on those that are in danger.
Ticks the rate limiter filters on each connected proxy channel.
This method checks whether any of the proxes' entity channels need to be sent.
The sending is usually triggered by a packet from the client. If no client packet has been received for a while, the ACKs etc should be sent.
This method ticks entity and entity type profilers

A retiring app must retain the same backup hash throughout the offload process or the entities' positions may not match where they are expected to be. Thus there is an isOffloading_ flag which marks a baseapp as having an immutable backup hash. Before that is set, we must check if the backup hash is suitable for the entire offloading process.
This class implement the main singleton object in the base application. Its main responsibility is to manage all of the bases on the local process.
